body.p:
Head-Quarters District of Kentucky,
PROVOST MARSHAL'S OFFICE,
Lexington, Ky., Sept 5" 1864.
General,

The General Commanding directs me to say that Privates Ervin Ray, Austin. P. Smith, and William Wilcox. 35" Ky. Inft. Vols. who are now confined in the Hopkins Co. jail, upon the charge of murdering James L. Clark, are entitled to trial by Gen'l Court Martial or Military Commission -- He therefore directs me to make a requisition on the Govenor, through your office, for these men, that they may be tried under the 30" section of the Act of Congress, approved March 3r" 1863.

I am Gen'l Very Respectfully
Your Obt. Servt.
R. Vance
Prov. Mar. Genl.
Dist of Ky.

Brig Genl. D. Lindsey.
Inspt. Gen'l and Adj't Gen'l
Ky Forces
Frankfort Ky

Hd. Qrs. Dist. Ky.
Pro. Mar.'s Office.
Lexington Ky.
Sept. 5th, 1864.
Vance R.
P. M. G. D of. Ky.

Gen. Comd'g directs him to say that Privates Ervin Ray, Austin P. Smith and Wm Wilcox, 35th Ky. Infty in Hopkins Co. Jail, on charge of murdering J. L. Clarke -- are entitled to tiral by Mil. ^Comn or gen'l^ C -- Martial: He makes requisition on the Gov. for these men, to try them by 30 Sect. Act of Congress. Mch 3rd /63
